revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Enable Networks |model=CR3000 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=02/20/2013 |manuf_country=Taiwan |manuf=Senao |manuf_model=WBR2100AFN |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=U2M-WBR2100AFN |ic_id=3616C-WBR2100AFN |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR1321 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=Q32B-104HIP |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR1321 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=SETUP-XX |default_ssid_regex=^SETUP-[A-F0-9]{2}$ |default_ip=192.168.99.1 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }}''300N Wi-Fi Router with Dragon88 Firmware and CloudCommand XP Service''
"7016A056000f" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The device, per the FCC photos, seems to be using the following... *'''Atheros''' AR1321-AL1A WiSoC *'''Eon''' Q32B-104HIP (4MB Flash)
Per the FCC label and manual, the default (setup) SSID appears to be '''SETUP-XX''' (where XX is the last 2 digits of the UIC [Unit Identification Code]).
Likely 68:51:B7 ('''PowerCloud Systems''') OUI (it's on the FCC label)
